title: CV
text: You can view my CV here (opens up in a separate tab).

title: Projects
text:
Master’s Thesis: Evaluating the Impact of Passing Conditions and Retakes on Misclassification in the IB’s Diploma Programme
Location: The Hague
Year: Ongoing
Supervisor: Anton Béguin
Languages: R, Fortran, Quarto
Conducting a master’s thesis focused on evaluating the impact of passing conditions and retakes on misclassification in the IB’s Diploma Programme.


Investigating Respondents’ Opinions on Gender Questions in Large-scale Surveys
Location: Utrecht
Year: Ongoing
Supervisor: Katharina Meitinger, Angelo Moretti
Languages: Excel
Coded responses in English, Dutch, German, and French for a survey investigating preferences concerning gender measures in survey data.


Literature Review on Composite Indicators in Small Area Estimation
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Angelo Moretti
Languages: /

Conducted a literature review of papers on composite indicators in small area estimation.
Searched online databases to build a formatted bibliography for the lead researcher.



Teaching Assistant for ‘Multivariate Analysis’ Summer School
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Dave Hessen
Languages: SPSS
Prepared resources for discussion sessions and led tutorial sessions, explaining basic multivariate analysis techniques to social science students. Provided SPSS support during tutorials.


Building an Application for Determining Optimal Allocation Ratios in Clinical Trials
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2024
Supervisor: Mirjam Moerbeek
Languages: R, R Shiny
Developed an R Shiny application to find optimal allocation ratios in clinical trials using the Bayes Factor (BF). Conducted a simulation study to investigate the effect of different values of the BF and treatment effect on length of study in group sequential clinical trials. Prepared multilevel model exercises for a summer course taught by the supervisor.


Academic Replication
Location: Utrecht Year: 2024
Supervisor: Independent project
Languages: R
Github: Repository Link
Replicated the findings of Homes et al. (2021) and created an academic poster to present the results and methodology.


Improving the LISS Panel Imputation Procedure
Location: Utrecht
Year: 2023
Languages: R, R Shiny
R Shiny: R Shiny Link
Created an R Shiny app to demonstrate the limitations of the LISS panel imputation procedure and improved upon it using multiple and stepwise imputation methods in R.

title: About me
text: I’m a graduate student and research assistant at Utrecht University in the Netherlands. My main areas of interest are educational measurement, survey design, and promoting reproducibility in research. I really enjoy teaching, and have been teaching French online for over three years, as well as teaching on summer courses. I’m also into music, you can learn about everything I play on my sister website.
